column5: I'm not sold on it either, but a bunch of the states have been doing this for a while, right? So, there must be a legit reason behind it.

IMHO, there are logical reasons for the non-resident requirement to purchase a 3 year Outdoors Card ($9) to fish in Ontario commencing 1 Jan 2009. The Outdoors Card provides a unique identifying number to everyone who fishes/hunts in Ontario, whether resident or non-resident. Privacy laws prevent Ontario from using driver licence numbers or social insurance numbers as unique identifiers. The Outdoors Card unique identifier affords access to Ontario electronic services (e.g. obtaining fishing licences on-line). And with an Ontario Outdoors Card, non-resident hunters will no longer be required to bring their hunting accreditation documentation with them each time. As well, lost licences can be easily replaced rather than having to purchase another licence (particularly expensive for a moose licence). Lastly, all fishing/hunting licence fees, fines, etc, collected by the Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources, are deposited into a Special Purpose Fund that provides much needed dollars to support fish and wildlife management in Ontario. Perhaps with a better understanding of the benefits of the Ontario Outdoors Card, you will be better able to accept the requirement and its nominal charge.

I think it will be a great benefit asnd help to the tackle shop owners and resort owners who now have to hand write all those licenses.
